articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in F (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in F (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th chord in the key of F, utilizing the D shape on the guitar, consists of the following notes: F, A, C, E, G, and D. This chord is an advanced and rich-sounding voicing that adds color and depth to music compositions. 

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- A (Major 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- E (Dominant 7th)
- G (Major 9th)
- D (Major 13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in F, played in the D shape, is often used in jazz, funk, R&B, and soul music genres. It provides a luxurious and sophisticated sound due to the harmonic richness added by the 13th extension. This chord can create a smooth and jazzy ambiance or add a soulful and funky flavor to musical compositions.

## Songs
1. "So What" by Miles Davis - This jazz classic prominently features extended chords, including the 13th, adding complexity and richness to the harmonic structure.
   
2. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder - In this soulful track, you can hear the 13th chord adding color and depth to the progression, enhancing the overall feel of the song.
   
3. "Pick Up the Pieces" by Average White Band - This funk hit utilizes extended chords like the 13th, contributing to the groovy and dynamic sound of the track.
